etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") upright + 人(人) (rén, "person") upside down = reversal; change -> ancient form of 化(化) (huà, "change")
etymology.interpretation: The character 𠤎 represents the concept of change or transformation by depicting two 人(人) (rén, "person") characters, one upright and one upside down, symbolizing a reversal or transformation.

examples.chinese: 这个𠤎很聪明(這個𠤎很聰明)。
他从不放弃(他從不放棄)，因为每个𠤎都有无限可能(因為每個𠤎都有無限可能)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng bù fàngqì, yīnwèi měi gè rén dōu yǒu wúxiàn kěnéng.
examples.english: He never gives up because every person has unlimited potential.
